krrood.entity_query_language.failures#

This module defines some custom exception types used by the entity_query_language package.

Exceptions#

QuantificationNotSatisfiedError

Represents a custom exception where the quantification constraints are not satisfied.

GreaterThanExpectedNumberOfSolutions

Represents an error when the number of solutions exceeds the

LessThanExpectedNumberOfSolutions

Represents an error that occurs when the number of solutions found

MultipleSolutionFound

Raised when a query unexpectedly yields more than one solution where a single

NoSolutionFound

Raised when a query does not yield any solution.

LogicalError

Raised when there is an error in the logical structure/evaluation of the query.

VariableCannotBeEvaluated

Raised when a variable cannot be evaluated due to missing or invalid information in the variable.

UsageError

Raised when there is an incorrect usage of the entity query language API.

NoKwargsInMatchVar

Raised when a match_variable is used without any keyword arguments.

WrongSelectableType

Raised when a wrong variable type is given to the select() statement.

LiteralConditionError

Raised when a literal (i.e. a non-variable) condition is given to the query.

CannotProcessResultOfGivenChildType

Raised when the entity query language API cannot process the results of a given child type during evaluation.

NonPositiveLimitValue

Raised when a limit value for the query results is not positive.

UnsupportedOperation

Raised when an operation is not supported by the entity query language API.

UnSupportedOperand

Raised when an operand is not supported by the operation.

UnsupportedNegation

Raised when negating quantifiers.

QuantificationSpecificationError

Raised when the quantification constraints specified on the query results are invalid or inconsistent.

QuantificationConsistencyError

Raised when the quantification constraints specified on the query results are inconsistent.

NegativeQuantificationError

Raised when the quantification constraints specified on the query results have a negative value.

InvalidChildType

Raised when an invalid entity type is given to the quantification operation.

InvalidEntityType

Raised when an invalid entity type is given to the quantification operation.

ClassDiagramError

An error related to the class diagram.

NoneWrappedFieldError

Raised when a field of a class is not wrapped by a WrappedField.

Module Contents#

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.QuantificationNotSatisfiedError#

Bases: krrood.utils.DataclassException, abc.ABC

Represents a custom exception where the quantification constraints are not satisfied.

This exception is used to indicate errors related to the quantification of the query results.

expression: krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.ResultQuantifier#

The result quantifier expression where the error occurred.

expected_number: int#

Expected number of solutions (i.e, quantification constraint value).

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.GreaterThanExpectedNumberOfSolutions#

Bases: QuantificationNotSatisfiedError

Represents an error when the number of solutions exceeds the expected threshold.

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.LessThanExpectedNumberOfSolutions#

Bases: QuantificationNotSatisfiedError

Represents an error that occurs when the number of solutions found is lower than the expected number.

found_number: int#

The number of solutions found.

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.MultipleSolutionFound#

Bases: GreaterThanExpectedNumberOfSolutions

Raised when a query unexpectedly yields more than one solution where a single result was expected.

expected_number: int = 1#

Expected number of solutions (i.e, quantification constraint value).

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.NoSolutionFound#

Bases: LessThanExpectedNumberOfSolutions

Raised when a query does not yield any solution.

expected_number: int = 1#

Expected number of solutions (i.e, quantification constraint value).

found_number: int = 0#

The number of solutions found.

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.WrongSelectableType#

Bases: UsageError

Raised when a wrong variable type is given to the select() statement.

wrong_variable_type: typing_extensions.Type#
expected_types: typing_extensions.List[typing_extensions.Type]#
exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.LiteralConditionError#

Bases: UsageError

Raised when a literal (i.e. a non-variable) condition is given to the query. Example:

>>> a = True
>>> body = let(Body, None)
>>> query = an(entity(body, a))

This could also happen when you are using a predicate or a symbolic_function and all the given arguments are literals. Example:

>>> predicate = HasType(Body("Body1"), Body)
>>> query = an(entity(let(Body, None), predicate))

So make sure that at least one of the arguments to the predicate or symbolic function are variables.

literal_conditions: typing_extensions.List[typing_extensions.Any]#
exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.CannotProcessResultOfGivenChildType#

Bases: UsageError

Raised when the entity query language API cannot process the results of a given child type during evaluation.

unsupported_child_type: typing_extensions.Type#

The unsupported child type.

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.NonPositiveLimitValue#

Bases: UsageError

Raised when a limit value for the query results is not positive.

wrong_limit_value: int#
exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.UnsupportedOperation#

Bases: UsageError

Raised when an operation is not supported by the entity query language API.

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.UnSupportedOperand#

Bases: UnsupportedOperation

Raised when an operand is not supported by the operation.

operation: typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.SymbolicExpression]#

The operation used.

unsupported_operand: typing_extensions.Any#

The operand that is not supported by the operation.

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.UnsupportedNegation#

Bases: UnsupportedOperation

Raised when negating quantifiers.

operation_type: typing_extensions.Type[krrood.entity_query_language.symbolic.SymbolicExpression]#

The type of the operation that is being negated.

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.QuantificationSpecificationError#

Bases: UsageError

Raised when the quantification constraints specified on the query results are invalid or inconsistent.

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.QuantificationConsistencyError#

Bases: QuantificationSpecificationError

Raised when the quantification constraints specified on the query results are inconsistent.

exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.NegativeQuantificationError#

Bases: QuantificationConsistencyError

Raised when the quantification constraints specified on the query results have a negative value.

message: str = 'ResultQuantificationConstraint must be a non-negative integer.'#
exception krrood.entity_query_language.failures.InvalidChildType#

Bases: UsageError

Raised when an invalid entity type is given to the quantification operation.

invalid_child_type: typing_extensions.Type#

The invalid child type.

correct_child_types: typing_extensions.List[typing_extensions.Type]#

The list of valid child types.

Bases: InvalidChildType
